Blog.post: After a year and eight months, I am headed back to California. I have loved living in NY, it has been such an awesome experience. Sometimes a bit dramaful, and really hard, but over all I made friends that I truly adore, and it will be hard to live without them. I had a job that I really learned a lot in, and offered me great experiences... but in the end my family and my friends are in Cali, and that is where my home is meant to be. I will miss NY, the action, the atmosphere, and metropolitan life. But, it will be fantactic to be back in California, and I look forward to all that I have in store.

After a couple of weeks of living in the great city, searching for a job, we decided that we needed to try to enjoy some of the free entertainment while we could. We tried to book tickets to many of the shows taped in NY, but they are quite hard to come by. Eventually we got tickets to see “The View”

Chisselle and I ventured out in the cold to see some sights. We tried to brave through the freezing temperatures, and went to see the Statue of Liberty, and some other sights. The cold made our sight seeing very limited.

After a 5-hour flight, with all the belongings I could manage to carry in tow, I jumped in a shuttle and was on my way to my new home. I arrived at my apartment on 112 West 72nd Street. Chisselle was there to greet me, and I unloaded in to my tiny studio apartment. For the 1st month I was in NY the temperature was never above 30 degrees. Brrrr! About two weeks after I moved in, Chisselle and I were getting into the elevator with our neighbor from next door, who we had not yet met. We told her that we just moved in, and she and I realized that we looked very familiar. I asked her where she was from, and she said Leucadia. Margaret, who attended my high school, and grew up about a mile away from me, was now my next-door neighbor in New York City! She said that in the 5 years that she had lived in NY she had never just bumped into anyone from San Diego. Margaret was a lifesaver in so many ways. She helped us out with getting to know the neighborhood, some new friends, and in finding a job.

urlLink A crocodile entering the swamp that our boat is in! So we take a lovely little swamp tour, in which we see all sorts of wildlife, bats, monkeys, birds and more, and we even took a dip in the beautiful clear water. Then we got back in the boat, went down a bit further, and took a right. That is where this little guy was also getting in for a dip in the water. I am not a fan of anything with sharp teeth, and our boat (which was really not all that stable or large) seemed like it would be a nice target for the croc, but he left us alone... and we were soon out of the swampy area, back in the clear (water that is)
urlLink Playa Conchal on the Pacific Coast of Costa Rica, as we head down from Playas del Coco to Playa Tamarindo

urlLink My adventurous friends go off to swing from the trees, Matt, Siori, and Ryan. So I am deathly afraid of heights, and there was no way in heck that I was going to go swing from any tree. So instead I took pictures, and made friends with a little monkey named Moneqo, who at first I did not know was tame, and thought it was attacking me when he ran to me and climbed up my leg… but then I was calmed down by his owner.. and the tiny monkey kept me entertained.
urlLink Beautiful views of Costa Rica's Pacific coast, at Father Rooster beach

To mix it up a little, we were graced by a blizzard instead of the usual freezing weather that we were slowly becoming accustomed to. This blizzard was a record breaker, and was the worst in 27 years. The streets were so covered in snow, that it brought traffic to a halt. People were cross-country skiing down the middle of the city streets. Central park was crowded with adults and kids sledding on pizza boxes, and snowboarding down small hills.

After nearly three months in New York, and no luck in the treacherous job-hunt, Chisselle was forced to move back to California. It was hard to adjust to NY without Chisselle, but it was her best option.
Chisselle and I went to see her movie that she had worked as assistant producer on, at the NYU film festival. It was very exciting to see her work on the “big” screen.

A welcome change of titles from: “unemployed” to “Program Coordinator”. I began working at The Elie Wiesel Foundation for Humanity. My new job would bring many new challenges, friends, and insights to both the non-profit and business world. I was ecstatic about my new opportunity to work for a Nobel Peace Prize winner, and a humanitarian foundation. My new office put me in the heart of mid-Manhattan.

Along with Margaret, Austin, & a few other friends, I attend an Art Opening at the Whitney in Midtown. The event is filled with SoHo savvy artists, and art lovers. We met the artist, and viewed all of his work on display. This event is one of my favorite New Yorker experiences!

yeaaa visitors! Akane, Bridget and Kim come to visit the big apple. We venture off to Central Park, an Italian dinner in Little Italy, the WTC, Statue of Liberty, Museums, and of course, some shopping!
urlLink Akane, Kim and Bridget in Central Park urlLink

The great search for a new apartment ends, and I move to Tribeca. I end up finding a three-bedroom apartment in Tribeca, in which the lady is renting out two of the rooms. After moving in, I realize that there are many house rules that were not discussed before hand. The lady basically does not want us to exist outside of our rooms in the apartment, and we have rules that state that our clothes must be put away neatly. My roommate and I come to find out that the building is subsidized housing, and between the two of us, we are probably paying more than the rent even is. Back on the hunt for an apartment again!

On a beautiful warm and humid summer day, we went to the first movie in the park for the summer movie series. We arrived to Bryant Park more than three hours before the movie was going to start, and the place was packed. The lawn was going to open at 7 PM, and we were ready with our blankets in hand to grab a spot on the lawn, but so were about 300 other people. So when the lawn officially opened, we ran with our blanket on to the lawn, grabbed a pretty decent spot, and tried to claim our territory as quick as possible. Then it was relaxing sitting in the warm night, drinking wine, and watching “Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid” on the big screen under the stars.
urlLink Michelle's Bridal Shower (A few of her friends from work, Cara, myself, Michelle, Linnea, and 2 other friends of Michelle's) urlLink

Fly home to California for my first visit since I had moved to New York. Although I had not been away for all that long, I was over excited to go home and see everyone. When I arrived home, there was another surprise visitor at the house, DAD!!! On the 13th we went to Casey’s promotion, and Ryan’s High School graduation. On the 14th I threw Michelle, one of my best frineds from High School, her Bridal Shower, and on the 15th, Father’s day, I spent quality time with my family, tiling the upstairs! Then it was back to NY!

Natalie, Natasa, Rolla & I go out for Tibetan food, in what is our attempt to culture ourselves through “ethnic dinners.” This is the first of many ethnic dinners, which are fun as they are something new, and a good chance to chat with friends.
July 31, 2003Michelle has her bridal tea party, and the Girl’s night out. We had high tea in downtown San Diego. Then we went to Old Town to enjoy some Mexican food, and spend time with the girls.
urlLink Michelle's Bridal tea party in Downtown San Diego (in front Aly, Michelle, Richards niece, Nicole, another of Richard's niece, in the back myself, Linnea, and Danielle) urlLink

Drive from LA to SD with Grandma Mark and Ari. Then we go to see Ian & Abby, my first time seeing the twins. I am so jealous that everyone else has seen my brother's twins but me... so excited to meet them!

Flew from Florida to LA with Lena and Vanna. My Grandma picked me up from the airport, and we spent the morning together. Then I get to meet up with some friends, since I did not have the opportunity the last trip. I meet up with Naita and Damien at UCLA. That night I get to see Ellen & Michael, Ari & Mark for dinner with my Grandma. Then Ari and I go out to coffee and meet up with Lena, Sherry, Siori, Nick, Kris, Damien & Shayan. Afterwards, Ari & I are off to spend the night at Grandma’s. It was so great to see all my family and friends.. i miss them

I take off from the hot & humid weather to enjoy some hot & humid weather on a beach. I meet up with Lena and her co-worker Vanna, for four gorgeous days in South Beach Florida. We enjoy some sun, some good food, and of course some dancing, and drinks! We stayed at a cute little hotel in the middle of the Art Deco district. The weather and beaches were absolutely stunning. We danced the nights away at some gorgeous venues, open-air bars, and clubs that had fabulous décor, making it feel like you were walking into heaven. Early on the 29th we had to leave our quick vacation and get back to reality.

Natasa hosts a nice night of lovely appetizers and games at her house. Natalie, Loraine, Daniela, Mark, Natasa, and one of her friends from work all enjoy an evening of delightful and intense competition. Reel clues?? I dont even watch movies enough to know who is who... :s

June 28th, no make that June 30th, or July 2nd! Finally after days of stress and confusion I move into my new apartment. The apartment is very nice, so is my new roommate, but unfortunately, the guy in charge is anything but nice! We were to move into the place on the 28th, the weekend before the 1st of the month. But then when I call to confirm, with my Uhaul van all booked and ready to pick up the next morning, I am told I can’t move in. Ok, so I move my stuff over with the van and stay in Tribeca until the 1st and then I move in, well the night before the 1st, I call to confirm, and no, the place is still not ready. So I stay with Natasa on the 1st, and finally on the 2nd I am able to move in. Despite hours of work my roommate put in cleaning the place it is still a mess from all the construction. A week goes by, and then I get the pleasure of meeting George. I hear a knock at my door, and it is someone needing to wash his hands. He tells me his name is George, he is the landlord of the building, and I ask him what he is talking about; I thought Jay was in charge. Well it turns out that Jihad Ageeb is charging us an extra $600 a month for the apartment. George tells me what the rent really is, and I tell him what Jay had told me, about it being more, and that Jay was in charge. Poor Jay is stopped in his tracks in what was proving to be a great scam, with him pocketing $600 a month. Uh, guess it is time to start apartment hunting, AGAIN!
urlLink Fourth Fireworks Show urlLink

Fireworks in New York! It was quite a day. After having some traditional BBQ dinner at Natalie and Loraine’s, we all headed over to meet up with Rolla, to enjoy the Fireworks display over the East River. The show was amazing, the fireworks were beautiful, and the crowd was huge. Thousands of people were assembled on the FDR highway and standing for hours waiting for the sun to go down, and the show to start. When it did, it proved that it was worth the wait!

On the move again… Four times in a 8 month period is normal right.. yeah right :P I move into a small basement apartment, in a place that is owned by a friend of Natalie’s family. So now that I am done with the mystery people and roommates, I am hoping to make this cute little apartment HOME for a while.

Another birthday celebration for Natasa, this time at the fabulous Cavo restaurant bar in Astoria. We ate drank, and danced the night away. The restaurant is so awesome, huge place behind the small appearance out front.. with a gorgeous back outdoor area.

We finally were able to get rush tickets to De La Guarda. We went early and stood in line for the much sought after tickets, and we were able to get tickets for all of us. Natalie, Loraine, Natasa, Rolla, and her friend Daniela & I went to enjoy the off Broadway show in which people fly, and run on the walls, and the audience is a part of the party, or I mean show.

Mark, Natalie and I go to the MOMA’s PS1. An “Urban Beach Party” It is a party at a museum where there is a live DJ, and an artist's rendition of the beach outside, in the middle of the museum. The experience was great. We checked out the art inside, and then checked out the DJ and danced under the sun. It was so great that I went back the next weekend with my roommates

Ummm, what happened to the lights? At 4:10 PM New York City along with the rest of the Northeastern US, & parts of Canada were blacked out by a power failure. My first thought was that the power had gone out in our office, or maybe our building. But then a minute later after a couple of phone calls, we learned that all of New York State was out, & even the whole northeastern region. So Natalie & I closed up the office, & began to walk uptown. You would never know how many people work in the buildings in the city, until they are all forced to come out on to the streets. We had successfully arranged a meeting spot with Loraine, but not with Natasa. We waited on the Manhattan side of the 59th Street Bridge for about 40 minutes, trying to contact her on her cell, but with no luck. Finally we trekked across the bridge, a little nervously, as we were with hundreds of other people, & we were unsure as to how the power outage had occurred, & what exactly was going on. The silent thought on everyone’s mind was the possibility of terrorism. Finally we reached the Queen’s side of the bridge, & walked anther 45 minutes or so until we made it to Natalie’s apartment. We just barely made it before sundown. With some 800 people stuck in elevators across the city, & thousands stranded on subways, we were worried about our unaccounted for friends. But the next morning we learned that everyone was safe. The night of the blackout we decided to take advantage of the darkness, & take out a telescope & check out the stars.

Natasa’s birthday, and we enjoy another movie under the stars, but this time in Socrates Park in Queens. We watch Monsoon wedding, and then enjoy some Tiramisu and sing Happy Birthday to the birthday girl.

Michelle & Richard’s Wedding Day! The wedding preparations began very early in the morning, around 6 AM. Then we were off to the church for the wedding at 2PM at St. John’s and then on to the reception at the Twin Oaks Country Club. The day was beautiful, and we danced into the night, until the happy couple were on their way!

Busy busy day! Drive up to South Coast Plaza to have breakfast with Siori and Damien, then off to have lunch with Erin in Carlsbad, then back home to get ready for the Rehearsal. After the rehearsal, we go to Firenzé for dinner. After dinner all the bridesmaids are off to Michelle’s house to spend the night.

A late night dinner in SoHo with the girls, and Rumiko and her fiancé, Rolla & Dania. We go to Café Noir, a trendy little restaurant in the heart of SoHo. Everything is great until flying roaches, some of the biggest I have ever seen, start flying across our table! We quickly pay the bill, and leave to somewhere, anywhere else! We end up in another little café, chat and enjoy some coffee, and then our oh-so trendy night is over.

I unsuccessfully try to go up and see art in action in Central Park. The “Light Cycle” was purposely scheduled on the 15th at 7:45 PM for the light that would have shined at that time. However, unfortunately for all the viewers, and the artist, the show was rained on, and stopped half way through.

My birthday in New York. Not too much of an eventful day, but I get to celebrate 3 times! Natalie, Loraine & Natasa took me out to dinner for my birthday (the night before), and then to coffee. Then on my birthday we went to the MOMA Queens, and then to Central Park. It was a beautiful day, so we sat and enjoyed. Then on Tuesday the 9th Rolla, Natalie, Natasa & I went to Le Souk for some Moroccan food. I was entertained with “Happy Birthday to you” song that was played over the sound system for the whole restaurant to hear. Another year...

Rolla convinced me to go to the Whitney Uptown (one of my favorite museums in New York, so it really does not take too much convincing) for a night of music and art. We get to see the new exhibit, and enjoy a live band in the museum.
Natasa, Natalie and I go to the Museum of the Moving Image. Afterwards we go to Café Bar (our local café hangout) and then to Mezzo with Loraine and Daniela for Natalie’s birthday dinner.

Natalie’s Birthday! Natasa and I take the birthday girl out to see Juanes in Madison Square Garden. It is my first time at the world famous venue, and my first time seeing my Colombian love, Juanes. The concert is fantastic, and afterwards we go to Natalie’s house for some birthday cake, and to have her open her gifts.

Nicole and I meet up with her friend from work to go to a birthday party and then off to Discotheque for some dancing! We had a great time out, and even saw a fashion show in the middle of the club, a little strange, but entertaining nonetheless.

Nicole arrives in NY! Now I get to have another old face in the new city, for good! Nicole arrives and stays at my apartment for a couple of days while she gets situated. We go to Times Square and other attractions so that she can see the sights. On the 3rd of October I help her move up to Stamford Connecticut, and get all settled in.

Natalie and I begin our new adventures in Salsa dancing. We head down to the Flatiron District to our first lesson. We were successful in our first four-week class learning the basic steps, but beyond that… well let’s say that we are signing up for more classes!

We have our second Board Meeting for the Foundation, followed by the Ethics Contest Winner’s Reception at the Harvard Club. At the reception we get to meet all of the winners, and they met Mr. Wiesel, which was definitly the highlight of the evening for the winners. Who said that non-Harvard grads could not enjoy the Ivy league club...

The day before thanksgiving I head up to the Upper West Side to check out the famous Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade floats. The place is absolutely packed with adults and children trying to see the floats. After about an hour of walking around the block, to only see one side of the floats, I call it an evening and head home

Judith and her husband, Jordan, are in New York visiting before they go overseas for Jordan’s new job with VW. Donna and I meet up with Judith & Jordan at the APT in the Meat Packing District. The very chic club is behind two doors in an industrial area that is very quiet outside, and inside everyone is dancing and having a fab time!
Donna and I meet up with Nicole to go on the Staten Island Ferry and see the Statue of Liberty, and the WTC. After that we head up to Times Square to have a bite and a drink in Planet Hollywood.
urlLink Donna & I at Planet Hollywood Times Square urlLink
Donna, Loraine, Natalie & I go Ice Skating in Central Park. I fell twice, not too graceful of a skater, but it was all in good fun!
Donna and I go to see the amazing show, “42nd Street.” The dancers start when the curtain goes up, and never stop until the show is over, it was a really fabulous show.

Natalie, Rachel, Donna and I go to have dinner up on the Upper East Side, and then to see Mr. Wiesel speak at the 92nd Street Y. The lecture lasts about an hour and a half, and is very interesting about politics, life and history.

Donna arrives for her visit in the city that will last until the 20th! She gets in around 6:30, I take her home to put her bags down. Then she is ready for some sightseeing, so I take her over to Times Square to see the amazing lights of the city!

Fly home to California to celebrate Christmas, and the New Year. It has almost been a year in the Big Apple, and the visit is, as always, very welcome. I get to see everyone at home for the holidays, and enjoy some time away from work, and relaxing with friends and family! A hectic trip as ALWAYS.. but fun nonetheless.
urlLink Natasa, myself and Nat at the Winter Gala urlLink

Natalie, Natasa & I help Rolla with her IAA event at the new Oriental Mandarin Hotel on Columbus Circle. The night was beautiful, and we enjoyed our volunteering along with some great appetizers, dinner, drinks and dancing!

First snowfall of the season proves to be a record breaker. The snow falls, and keeps falling! The second day of the snowstorm is an official blizzard. The total snowfall in Central Park is just over 18 inches.

Rolla and I go to check out a play at Theater Row, called “Our Fathers.” The play is a two person, one act play, that is well done, but the begining was so slow, and the theater is so small.. that if you fall asleep the actors will see you sleeping!
urlLink Charlene and her girls: Malia, Willow and Kiana, in Hana

urlLink So after our long trek into Brooklyn, across the Brooklyn Bridge, stopping in at Juniors for some delicious cheese cake, and then walking to the Botanic Garden, we are able to stop and enjoy the flowers. These tulips were gorgeous, and the picture does not really do justice to the imensity of the color, and number of tulips there. The Gardens also had a festival for the Sakura (cherry blossom trees) and all of the trees were in bloom. Along with the beautiful scenery there was some Japanese music, and cuisine.
urlLink Fiona & I on a walk to Junior's with Nicole for some delicious cheese cake...
urlLink My Jolly Giant friend, Marina and Loraine at Socrates Park, Astoria
urlLink Michelle's visit to New York (back, Michelle's Nana Fay, and Uncle Rob, front, Aly, myself, and Michelle)

urlLink Michelle & I doing what we love to do, shopping in SoHo. =) After we left the WTC and the great shopping at Century 21, we head over to SoHo, for some more shopping, and a little ice cream sundae treat at one of my favorite W. Broadway shops, Lounge.

urlLink After a night out with Nana up in Yonkers, at the Irish pub, we spend the next day seeing some sights, and shopping. This is us at the site of the WTC. Michelle and I did not know if it was appropriate to take pictures in front of the site, and I actually had refrained for the time I had been in NY, and when I had visited before. But with so many others taking photographs, and knowing that the site is quickly being rebuilt, we decided that we should take pictures so that we can have a memory of visiting the site.
urlLink Natalie, myself and Natasa at the Summer Gala at the infamous New York Rainbow Room urlLink

urlLink So Natalie is leaving to go on a trip to Southern Italy, and Croatia... but she will be informing us with updates on her blog, to let us know how the trip is going, and all that jazz... So we wish her a very fun trip, and can't wait to hear all the details.. don't worry Nat, Lor and I will hold down the fort, ENJOY! urlLink http://www.natv.blogspot.com/
urlLink Nicole and I at Avenue Cafe in Astoria enjoying some delicious sandwiches & crepes
Michelle's Bridal Shower urlLink Michelle's Bridal Shower at her parent's house in California
Charlene, Kiana, Malia, Gary urlLink Ok, so I didn't take this picture, my parents did.. but just like with my brother's fam, I think it is a cute family picture.
urlLink I return from Hawaii, and this is the weather that I am greeted with... arggghh

urlLink I was very lucky to get out of the icy cold city for a while, and spend some time with my family in Maui. It was the weekend of my dad's birthday, but we actually surprised my mom with a birthday bash a month before her big day! Clockwise from top left; My mom as she comes up stairs and is surprised, Ryan using Kiana to do some weight lifting, Casey and Ryan, Ryan Kiana and Casey pose near the sea.
urlLink Here is my lil' bro turning 19!
Atlantic City urlLink My first and only time to Atlantic City... to put it simply it is no Vegas... Top; Mrs. Vlakancic, Natalie, Loraine. Bottom, the Trump Taj Mahal

Peruvian Dinner in the East Village urlLink After a day at the Orchid Show, Natalie and I meet up with Rolla, Elyn, Natasa, Daniela, Nicole, Fiona and Jane for some Peruvian dinner in the East Village.
urlLink Here we are taking a picture of ourselves at the Orchid Show.
Orchid Show @ Rockefeller Center urlLink
urlLink Actually I didn't take this photo, but it was emailed to me, and I think it is a very cute family picture of PRIMA (Pam, Rich, Ian, Maddie, Abby) L-R Rich, Maddie, Ian, Abby, and Pam

urlLink The Yankees stadium really is as cool as everyone says it is. Being the only American in our group the game was kind of funny, as it is such an American sport.. I felt like we were tourists at a game, odd feeling.. Nicole (South African) Fiona (Australian) Caroline (Swedish)... Nicole living here for quite some time knows the game. Top Nicole and I, The Yankees field, Fiona Nicole & Caroline in our freezing seats.

urlLink Seeing Liz Phair in concert was a huge disappointment.. I think that it is really her older albums that Loraine and I liked, and she is nothing like what she used to be. The opening act, Rachel Yamagata (a Hapa! :) ) was cool to see in concert, but she was sick, and I guess not up to her usual performance. Anyways, after stading at the Roseland Ballroom for 3 hours we were starving, and headed to Mickey D's... hahaha
Lor's fruit art urlLink

ADL Gala urlLink So the ADL threw Mr. Wiesel a 75th Birthday party at the Waldorf Astoria, and we went, woohoo!!! It was a very cool event with some very A list people, John Voight, Hillary Clinton, Kofi Annan, Gen. Wesley Clark, Tom Brokaw, Ted Koppel etc. L-R Natalie, me, Rachel

urlLink After a long walk in from Manhattan, we finally made it to the Botanic Gardens. They had a ton of cherry blossom trees in bloom, as well as tulips, and other spring flower. L-R Asian sculpture, Nicole and I rest near the tulips, the sea of cherry blossoms over head.
on our way from Juniors (yumm) to the Brooklyn Botanic Garden urlLink
urlLink
Brooklyn Bridge urlLink Top Nicole and Fiona on the Bridge, bottom a view from the bridge facing Brooklyn

A day in the park urlLink I went up to the top of Central Park to check out the Mano a Mano Monarch exhibit, and then took a walk in the upper part of the park, having lived here for a year and a half, and I had still not seen most of the park. Top left, the Conservatory, right; The Monarch tent, bottom the Jackie Onasis Resevoir taken from the north most end.
urlLink What Nat & I thought was a cool shot of the police motorcycles that were going to lead the torch through NY
Astoria: Olympic Torch Relay urlLink
urlLink Me & my Greek spirit
urlLink Top: Michelle and I at the WTC, middle, Michelle: Nana Fay, Aly, and me, Bottom: Michelle and I
Natalie, me, and Natasa at the Summer Ball for the IAA NY chapter urlLink
Nat and I dress up with 20's style hats and accesories... urlLink
Coney Island "siren fest"... Lets just say that this was my first and ONLY time to Coney Island... really do not like the place... urlLink
urlLink This is not such an unusual sight for me, but for all my friends in NY it was a new experience. We had a great time watching the skateboarders and BMXers ride the ramps.. didnt we Lor ;)
Long Beach, Long Island NY (the beach that charges $6 per person to enter, gotta love NY) urlLink
from the past year, and the different things I have done!
